results.title: For whom the bell tolls
results.brief_description: A romantic drama set in 1937, during the Spanish Civil War. Gary Cooper plays Robert Jordan, an American who has joined a guerilla group and has been assigned to blow-up a Falangist controlled Bridge. He meets and falls in love with a young woman, played by Ingrid Bergman, who joined the group after her brutal treatment at the hands of the enemy. Written by Dudley Nichols, based on the novel by Ernest Hemingway, which was unanimously voted the best novel of the year in 1941 by the Pulitzer Prize committee, but was vetoed for political reasons. Cast also includes Akim Tamiroff, Arturo de Cordova and Katina Paxinou. Music by Victor Young. Photography by Ray Rennahan. Edited by Sherman Todd and John F. Link. (Awards: Katina Paxinou, Oscar 1943, Best Supporting Actress)

results.title: La Frontera
results.creator_credit: Ricardo Larrain, Dolores Soler, Mara Sanchex, Filmocentro, Cine XXI, ION Productions and Television Espanola
results.brief_description: In 1985, Santiago, Chile, a mathematics teacher, Ramiro Orellana (Patricio Contreras), is exiled to a remote local village after protesting against the abduction and disappearance of a colleague. At this faraway place, accessible only by water and once flooded by a tidal wave, Ramiro’s movements are kept in check by two local officials, whose interaction recalls the comic routines of Abbot and Costello. Though in exile, Ramiro gradually becomes acquainted with the local villagers and falls in love with a rather eccentric Spanish woman burdened with minding her mad father. Director Ricardo Larrain portrays the remote village as a mythic, natural, and innocent world, where our hero rekindles love and stumbles upon a past era buried beneath the water. In this way, Larrain affirms the richness of local cultures in opposition to the frenetic, superficial nature of the modern city. However, as a satellite of the central government, this place is also enmeshed in the absurdity of red tape and the cruel nature of politics itself, whereby the ruling regime can so easily incriminate an innocent and idealistic man. Drawing on the cinema of Bunuel and Tomas Gutierrez Alea, and with rich, plentiful characterisations and fluid storytelling, La Frontera is a fine example of contemporary Chilean cinema. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Gigi
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Gigi (Leslie Caron) is a young tomboy being transformed by her Aunts in the hope of her becoming a beautiful and successful courtesan - just like themselves in their hey day - to become the mistress of Gaston (Louis Jourdan). Inevitably, Gaston falls in love with Gigi, captivated by her innocence and child like manner. The protagonist of the film is provided by Maurice Chevalier as Gaston’s Uncle, who was once in love with Gigi’s aunt. Considered the last great film in Minelli’s career, the story is based on a story by Colette. Cast also includes Hermione Gingold, Eva Gabor and Isabel Jeans. (Awards: 13 Academy awards, including Best Picture, 1958)

results.title: Wait until dark
results.creator_credit: Terence Young, Mel Ferrer and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Susy is an independent and resourceful housewife learning to cope with her blindness resulted from a recent accident. Susy’s life changes drastically when she is terrorised by a group of criminals who believe she is in possession of a doll used by them to smuggle drugs into the country. Alone and cut off from the world outside, Susy must fight for her life against this group of ruthless criminals. Music by Henry Mancini. Cast includes: Audrey Hepburn, Alan Arkin, Richard Crenna, Eferm Zimbalist Jr. and Jack Weston.

results.title: Man of marble = Czlowiek z marmuru
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda, Zespol Filmowy 'X' and Film Polski
results.brief_description: Lauded a national hero in the 1950s due to his skills at his trade, Mateusz Birkut has fallen into the shadows. In making a film of the bricklayer’s life, documentary director Krystyna Janda discovers that he used his fame to become involved in politics - resulting in the government wiping out all traces of his accomplishments. Excised by the Polish censors when first released, ‘Man of marble’ uses reconstructions of old black and white newsreels and matches the stylistic tenets of the documentary genre. (Awards: Winner of the FIPRESCI award, Cannes Film Festival, 1978). In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Last seduction
results.creator_credit: John Dahl, Jonathan Shestack and ITC Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: An updated film noir centering around Bridget Gregory, a beautiful, intelligent and ambitious femme fatal. After convincing her doctor husband to pull off a $700,000 cocaine deal, Bridget takes of with the money and hides out in a small town, where she meets Mike. She is tracked down by a private investigator hired by her husband. As the two start to close in on Bridget, she involves Mike in an elaborate scheme to keep the money and get rid of her husband. Cast includes: Linda Fiorentino, Peter Berg, Bill Pullman, J.T. Walsh and Bill Nunn. (Awards: New York)

results.title: Pretty village pretty flame = Lepa sela lepo gore
results.creator_credit: Srdjan Dragojevic, Goran Bjelogrlic and Cobra Film Development
results.brief_description: Set in the early days of the Bosnian War, this film is based around the relationship of two young men who find themselves on opposing sides in the conflict. Holed up in a tunnel, the Serbian soldiers strive to maintain their bawdy sense of humour while under siege from Muslim soldiers who are torturing and killing those around them. The continuing problem of accountability is highlighted, as soldiers on each side deny responsibility for the atrocities which have affected the other. Meanwhile, their country is torn apart. A powerful anti-war film that conveys the futility of war through the often ironic use of popular music, including a rendition of John Lennon’s “Give peace a chance”. In Serbian with English subtitles.

results.title: Shirley Valentine
results.brief_description: Pauline Collins is Shirley Valentine-Bradshaw, a housewife and mother in cold dull England who dreams of adventure and stimulation. Her best friend wins a holiday in Greece and Shirley decides to come along. On the beautiful island of Mykonos, Shirley finds herself increasingly attracted to fisherman Costas (Tom Conti), and before the whirl wind two weeks on the Aegean is finished, she has to make big decisions about whether to return to her middle-class life back in England or to pursue the adventures of a new life promised by Greece and Costa. With the magical locales of Mykonos as a backdrop, “Shirley Valentine” is a perennial crowd pleasing comedy which also manages to develop some perceptive insights into the emotions and experiences of women in the middle years of their lives.

results.title: The Killer nun = Suor omicidi [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Giulio Berruti, Enzo Gallo and Cinesud
results.brief_description: A former ‘video-nasty’ and one of the few examples of the perversely themed ‘nunsploitation’ genre, which is basically a thinly veiled excuse for some soft core erotica. The usual ingredients for this genre are all present in The Killer nun, that being drug addicted nuns, lesbianism, sadism, murder, necrophilia and lashings of nudity. Anita Ekberg stars as sister Gertrude a sexually repressed, morphine addicted nun who descends into madness when her elderly patients begin to get murdered, making her the prime suspect. Soon enough the unhinged sister is shooting up, having sex with strange men and making inappropriate advances at her fellow sisters. Cast includes Joe Dallesandro, Alida Valli, Lou Castel. Also known as Suor omicidi.

results.title: Hook
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Gerald Molen, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg filters J.M. Barrie’s ‘Peter Pan’ through a distinctly 90’s sensibility in ‘Hook’, a film of lost opportunities. Peter Pan has become Peter Banning (Robin Williams), a 40 year old lawyer with a permanent scowl on his face. Banning has lost all memory of being Peter Pan, and he is also in danger of losing his wife and children. When Peter and his family travel to London to visit Granny Wendy, Peter’s children are kidnapped by Captain Hook. As Peter recalls who he is and re-discovers his happy thoughts, he transforms into the Peter Pan of the past and goes to rescue his children. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.
